docstr: `NINT` — Nearest whole number ### Description `NINT(A)` rounds its argument to the nearest whole number. ### Syntax `RESULT = NINT(A [, KIND])` ### Arguments . | `KIND` | (Optional) An `INTEGER` initialization expression indicating the kind parameter of the result. ### Return value Returns `A` with the fractional portion of its magnitude eliminated by rounding to the nearest whole number and with its sign preserved, converted to an `INTEGER` of the default kind. ### Example ``` program test_nint   real(4) x4   real(8) x8   x4 = 1.234E0_4   x8 = 4.321_8   print *, nint(x4), idnint(x8) end program test_nint ``` ### Specific names | Name | Argument | Return Type | Standard | `NINT(A)` | `REAL(4) A` | `INTEGER` | Fortran 95 and later | `IDNINT(A)` | `REAL(8) A` | `INTEGER` | Fortran 95 and later ### Standard Fortran 77 and later, with `KIND` argument Fortran 90 and later ### Class Elemental function ### See also CEILING, FLOOR
